name: stjude_chipseq_bwa_backtrack_fastq_read_mapper
title: BWA-backtrack FASTQ Read Mapper (connect to ChIP-seq parameter wrapper)
summary: Maps FASTQ reads (paired or unpaired) to a reference genome with the BWA-backtrack algorithm

inputSpec.name: reads_fastqgz
inputSpec.label: Reads
inputSpec.help: A file, in gzipped FASTQ format, with the reads to be mapped (or the left reads, for paired pairs).

inputSpec.name: reads2_fastqgz
inputSpec.label: Reads (right mates)
inputSpec.help: (Optional) A file, in gzipped FASTQ format, with the right reads to be mapped (for paired reads).

inputSpec.name: parameter_file
inputSpec.label: file which has parameters passed from other app

inputSpec.name: genomeindex_targz
inputSpec.label: BWA reference genome index
inputSpec.help: A file, in gzipped tar archive format, with the reference genome sequence already indexed with BWA.

inputSpec.name: add_read_group
inputSpec.label: Add read group information to the mappings (required by downstream GATK)?
inputSpec.help: Select this (and supply read group information), to add read group information to the output mappings. Certain read group information (id, sample, etc.) is required for downstream analysis by GATK. Selecting this will supply the '-r' option to 'bwa samse' (or 'bwa sampe').

inputSpec.name: read_group_id
inputSpec.label: Read group id
inputSpec.help: The read group identifier (RG ID tag) to add to the mappings. This must be a string (without spaces) uniquely identifying this dataset (instrument+run+lane) across all sequencing data in the world. (Downstream analysis by GATK will require this).

inputSpec.name: read_group_platform
inputSpec.label: Read group platform
inputSpec.help: The read group platform (RG PL tag) to add to the mappings. Per the SAM spec, valid values are CAPILLARY, LS454, ILLUMINA, SOLID, HELICOS, IONTORRENT and PACBIO. (Downstream analysis by GATK does not currently use this, but was in the past. It may return in the future, so it's a good idea to properly populate this field).

inputSpec.name: read_group_platform_unit
inputSpec.label: Read group platform unit
inputSpec.help: The read group platform unit (RG PU tag) to add to the mappings. This is a string (without spaces), usually flowcell-barcode.lane for Illumina or slide for SOLiD. (Not currently used by GATK.)

inputSpec.name: read_group_library
inputSpec.label: Read group library
inputSpec.help: The read group library (RG LB tag) to add to the mappings. This is a string (without spaces) identifying the sequencing library prep for this experiment. (Picard MarkDuplicates uses this field to determine which read groups might contain molecular duplicates, in case the same DNA library was sequenced on multiple lanes; not currently used by GATK).

inputSpec.name: read_group_sample
inputSpec.label: Read group sample
inputSpec.help: The read group sample (RG SM tag) to add to the mappings. This must be a string (without spaces) uniquely identifying the biological sample being sequenced. (GATK treats all read groups with the same SM value as containing sequencing data for the same sample. Therefore it's critical that the SM field be correctly specified, especially when performing simultaneous multi-sample variation calling with the GATK UnifiedGenotyper module).

inputSpec.name: phred64
inputSpec.label: Quality scores encoded in PHRED-64 instead of PHRED-33?
inputSpec.help: Select this if the quality scores in the input FASTQ files are encoded using PHRED-64 (Illumina 1.3-1.5) instead of PHRED-33 (Sanger, Illumina 1.8+). This will supply the '-I' option to 'bwa aln'.

inputSpec.name: skip_casava_filtered
inputSpec.label: Skip CASAVA-filtered reads?
inputSpec.help: Select this to ignore reads which indicate that they have been filtered out by Illumina's CASAVA 1.8+ pipeline. (This is detected by the presence of ':Y' in the read name). This will supply the '-Y' option to 'bwa aln'.

inputSpec.name: preload_index
inputSpec.label: Preload index into memory?
inputSpec.help: Select this if you want BWA to load the entire genome index into memory to reduce disk operations. With this option, at least 1.25N bytes of memory are required, where N is the length of the genome. This will supply the '-P' option to 'bwa sampe' (for paired reads only).

inputSpec.name: advanced_aln_options
inputSpec.label: Advanced command line options for 'bwa aln'
inputSpec.help: Advanced command line options that will be supplied directly to the 'bwa aln' execution. WARNING: if provided, these advanced options will be used INSTEAD of the common options. Example: -k 3 -N

inputSpec.name: advanced_samse_options
inputSpec.label: Advanced command line options for 'bwa samse'
inputSpec.help: Advanced command line options that will be supplied directly to the 'bwa samse' execution. WARNING: if provided, these advanced options will be used INSTEAD of the common options. Example: -n 1 -r @RG\\tID:foo\\tSM:bar

inputSpec.name: advanced_sampe_options
inputSpec.label: Advanced command line options for 'bwa sampe'
inputSpec.help: Advanced command line options that will be supplied directly to the 'bwa sampe' execution. WARNING: if provided, these advanced options will be used INSTEAD of the common options. Example: -a 650 -r @RG\\tID:foo\\tSM:bar

outputSpec.name: sorted_bam
outputSpec.label: Sorted mappings
outputSpec.help: A coordinate-sorted BAM file with the resulting mappings.

outputSpec.name: bwa_log
outputSpec.label: log for bwa
outputSpec.help: cmd and software version are recorded.
